did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection consists of four letters, all written while James was in England.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Henry James Letters must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Henry James Letters, Ms1974-008, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection of Henry James Letters were acquired prior to 1974.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Henry James Letters was completed in 1974. Additional description was completed in March 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Henry James was born in New York, NY, in 1843. During his lifetime, he was a literary and art critic (writing for Nation from 1866-1869 and for Atlantic from 1866-1872), novelist, and short story author. In addition, he also wrote travel essays and plays. During the 1870s and 1880s, he wrote several of his best-known works: Daisy Miller: A Study (1878), Portrait of a LadyÂ (1881), and The Bostonians (1886). James was a frequent traveler and corresponded with other writers in the United States and abroad. In 1915, he emigrated to England. He died the following year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of four letters, all written while James was in England, one each to Lady Grace Baring, "Mrs. Sheridan," the Society of Authors, and writer George Gissing.
